{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mast cells are a type of white blood cell that are part of the immune system. They are present in various tissues throughout the body, including the pulp of the teeth. They play a role in inflammation and allergic reactions, so they would be present in inflamed pulp. However, they are also present in normal pulp as part of the body's immune defense.", "answer_choice": "B. Present in normal pulp"}
